page.title: 20The People of Much Hadham
page.content: Many famous people have resided in Much Hadham. Today one of the most famous residents is Henry Moore, the sculptor, who lives at "Hoglands" Perry Green.There is a stone carving made by Henry Moore at the West door of the parish church.The Govenor of the Bank of England from 1920-1944, Lord Norman lived at Moor Place and his family still lives there to this day. The village is considered a very desirable place in which to live and consequently property is expensive. The village Fete is held annually on August Bank Holiday and raises on average about Â£4,500.The money is used for the improvement and maintainance of village facilities. The villagers are proud of their village and view with sadness the inevitable changes which take place in society.
